cards.name: Sun Titan
cards.text:
Vigilance
Whenever Sun Titan enters the battlefield or attacks, you may return target permanent card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: A blazing sun that never sets.
cards.original_text: VigilanceWhenever Sun Titan enters the battlefield or attacks, you may return target permanent card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

rulings.text: A permanent card is an artifact, creature, enchantment, land, or planeswalker card.

The converted mana cost of a card in your graveyard is determined solely by the mana symbols printed in its upper right corner. The converted mana cost is the total amount of mana in that cost, regardless of color. For example, a card with mana cost {3}{U}{U} has converted mana cost 5.
If the mana cost of a card in your graveyard includes {X}, X is considered to be 0.
If a card in your graveyard has no mana symbols in its upper right corner (because it's a land card, for example), its converted mana cost is 0.

cards.name: Somberwald Vigilante
cards.text: Whenever Somberwald Vigilante becomes blocked by a creature, Somberwald Vigilante deals 1 damage to that creature.
cards.flavor: He has nothing left but his resentment.
cards.original_text: Whenever Somberwald Vigilante becomes blocked by a creature, Somberwald Vigilante deals 1 damage to that creature.

rulings.text: Somberwald Vigilante's ability will trigger for each creature it becomes blocked by.
The ability resolves before combat damage is dealt, so it could cause blocking creatures to be destroyed and thus not deal combat damage.

foreign_names.name: ソンバーワルドの自警団

cards.name: Figure of Destiny
cards.text:
{R/W}: Figure of Destiny becomes a Kithkin Spirit with base power and toughness 2/2.
{R/W}{R/W}{R/W}: If Figure of Destiny is a Spirit, it becomes a Kithkin Spirit Warrior with base power and toughness 4/4.
{R/W}{R/W}{R/W}{R/W}{R/W}{R/W}: If Figure of Destiny is a Warrior, it becomes a Kithkin Spirit Warrior Avatar with base power and toughness 8/8, flying, and first strike.
cards.original_text: {R/W}: Figure of Destiny becomes a 2/2 Kithkin Spirit.{R/W}{R/W}{R/W}: If Figure of Destiny is a Spirit, it becomes a 4/4 Kithkin Spirit Warrior.{R/W}{R/W}{R/W}{R/W}{R/W}{R/W}: If Figure of Destiny is a Warrior, it becomes an 8/8 Kithkin Spirit Warrior Avatar with flying and first strike.

rulings.text: None of these abilities has a duration. If one of them resolves, it will remain in effect until the game ends, Figure of Destiny leaves the battlefield, or some subsequent effect changes its characteristics, whichever comes first.

Figure of Destiny's abilities overwrite its power, toughness, and creature types. Typically, those abilities are activated in the order they appear on the card. However, if Figure of Destiny is an 8/8 Kithkin Spirit Warrior Avatar with flying and first strike, and you activate its first ability, it will become a 2/2 Kithkin Spirit that still has flying and first strike.

You can activate Figure of Destiny's second and third abilities regardless of what creature types it is. Each of those abilities checks Figure of Destiny's creature types when that ability resolves. If Figure of Destiny isn't the appropriate creature type at that time, the ability does nothing.
Figure of Destiny's second ability checks whether it's a Spirit, and its third ability checks whether it's a Warrior. It doesn't matter how it became the appropriate creature type.

The effect from the ability overwrites other effects that set power and/or toughness if and only if those effects existed before the ability resolved. It will not overwrite effects that modify power or toughness (whether from a static ability, counters, or a resolved spell or ability), nor will it overwrite effects that set power and toughness which come into existence after the ability resolves. Effects that switch the creature's power and toughness are always applied after any other power or toughness changing effects, including this one, regardless of the order in which they are created.

cards.name: Cavalry Pegasus
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Cavalry Pegasus attacks, each attacking Human gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"It is hope, hooved and winged."
—Cymede, queen of Akros
cards.original_text: FlyingWhenever Cavalry Pegasus attacks, each attacking Human gains flying until end of turn.

rulings.text: Once the triggered ability resolves, the attacking Humans will continue to have flying even if Cavalry Pegasus leaves the battlefield.
The attacking Humans gain flying before blockers are declared.

cards.name: Fencing Ace
cards.text: Double strike (This creature deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
cards.flavor: His prowess gives the guildless hope that they can hold out against tyranny.
cards.original_text: Double strike (This creature deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

cards.text: Vigilance
cards.flavor: "Once more into Devil's Breach, soldiers. I want another devil tail for my collection."

cards.name: Stun Sniper
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Stun Sniper deals 1 damage to target creature. Tap that creature.
cards.flavor: The tips of her bolts are blunt, but her aim is deadly sharp.
cards.original_text: {1}, {T}: Stun Sniper deals 1 damage to target creature. Tap that creature.

cards.name: Truefire Paladin
cards.text:
Vigilance
{R}{W}: Truefire Paladin gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
{R}{W}: Truefire Paladin gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.original_text: Vigilance{R}{W}: Truefire Paladin gets +2/+0 until end of turn.{R}{W}: Truefire Paladin gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Auramancer
cards.text: When Auramancer enters the battlefield, you may return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: "In memories, we can find our deepest reserves of strength."
cards.original_text: When Auramancer enters the battlefield, you may return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Freewind Equenaut
cards.text:
Flying
As long as Freewind Equenaut is enchanted, it has "{T}: Freewind Equenaut deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature."
cards.flavor: Confront her, and feel the hooves of her steed. Ignore her, and feel the sting of her arrow.
cards.original_text: FlyingAs long as Freewind Equenaut is enchanted, it has "{T}: Freewind Equenaut deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature."

cards.name: Anax and Cymede
cards.text:
First strike, vigilance
Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Anax and Cymede, creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Akros's greatest heroes are also its royalty.
cards.original_text: First strike, vigilanceHeroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Anax and Cymede, creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain trample until end of turn.

rulings.text: Only creatures you control when the heroic ability resolves will get the bonuses. Creatures that come under your control later in the turn will not.
Heroic abilities will resolve before the spell that caused them to trigger.
Heroic abilities will trigger only once per spell, even if that spell targets the creature with the heroic ability multiple times.
Heroic abilities won't trigger when a copy of a spell is created on the stack or when a spell's targets are changed to include a creature with a heroic ability.

foreign_names.name: アナックスとサイミーディ

cards.name: Armory Guard
cards.text: Armory Guard has vigilance as long as you control a Gate.
cards.flavor: The Dimir agents watched from the shadows. "Eight hours, and I've yet to see him blink," Nefara hissed. "I suggest we find another way in."
cards.original_text: Armory Guard has vigilance as long as you control a Gate.

rulings.text: Vigilance only matters when Armory Guard is being declared as an attacking creature. If Armory Guard is already attacking, losing control of your only Gate won't cause Armory Guard to become tapped or to leave combat.

cards.name: Gustcloak Sentinel
cards.text: Whenever Gustcloak Sentinel becomes blocked, you may untap it and remove it from combat.
cards.flavor: Entire platoons have mysteriously vanished from battle, leaving enemy weapons to slice through empty air.
cards.original_text: Whenever Gustcloak Sentinel becomes blocked, you may untap it and remove it from combat.

cards.name: Dawnstrike Paladin
cards.text:
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
cards.flavor: She crushes darkness beneath her charger's hooves.
cards.original_text: VigilanceLifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Nobilis of War
cards.text:
Flying
Attacking creatures you control get +2/+0.
cards.flavor:
"A great siege is a banquet to him; a long and terrible battle, the most exquisite delicacy."
—The Seer's Parables
cards.original_text: FlyingAttacking creatures you control get +2/+0.

rulings.text: This is a static ability. Attacking creatures you control will get +2/+0 from the moment they're declared as attackers (or enter the battlefield attacking) until the moment the combat phase ends, they're removed from combat, or Nobilis of War leaves the battlefield, whichever comes first.

cards.name: Kamahl, Pit Fighter
cards.text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
{T}: Kamahl, Pit Fighter deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: In times when freedom seems lost, great souls arise to reclaim it.
cards.original_text: Haste{T}: Kamahl, Pit Fighter deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

rulings.text: The Legend rule only applies to two legendary permanents with identical names. If the names are different, even if they depict the same character, the rule does not apply.

foreign_names.name: ピット・ファイター、カマール

cards.name: Condemn
cards.text: Put target attacking creature on the bottom of its owner's library. Its controller gains life equal to its toughness.
cards.flavor:
"No doubt the arbiters would put you away, after all the documents are signed. But I will have justice now."
—Alovnek, Boros guildmage
cards.original_text: Put target attacking creature on the bottom of its owner's library. Its controller gains life equal to its toughness.

rulings.text: The affected creature's last known existence on the battlefield is checked to determine its toughness.

cards.name: Daily Regimen
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{1}{W}: Put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.
cards.flavor: What self-indulgence tears down, discipline builds up again.
cards.original_text: Enchant creature{1}{W}: Put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.

rulings.text: The +1/+1 counters that are put on the enchanted creature are independent of Daily Regimen. If Daily Regimen leaves the battlefield or is moved to another creature, the counters will stay put.

cards.name: Pay No Heed
cards.text: Prevent all damage a source of your choice would deal this turn.
cards.flavor: "My course is before me. There is nothing behind me."
cards.original_text: Prevent all damage a source of your choice would deal this turn.

rulings.text: Pay No Heed doesn't target anything. You can choose a source with hexproof, for example. You choose the damage source as Pay No Heed resolves.
If the chosen source is a permanent spell, damage dealt later in the turn by the permanent it becomes will also be prevented.

cards.name: Righteousness
cards.text: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Sometimes the greatest strength is the strength of conviction.
cards.original_text: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

rulings.text: A "blocking creature" is one that has been declared as a blocker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield blocking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be a blocking creature through the end of combat step, even if the creature or creatures it was blocking are no longer on the battlefield or have otherwise left combat.

cards.name: Stand Firm
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)
cards.original_text: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Magma Jet
cards.text: Magma Jet deals 2 damage to any target. Scry 2.
cards.original_text: Magma Jet deals 2 damage to target creature or player. Scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

rulings.text: When you scry, you may put all the cards you look at back on top of your library, you may put all of those cards on the bottom of your library, or you may put some of those cards on top and the rest of them on the bottom.
You choose how to order cards returned to your library after scrying no matter where you put them.
You perform the actions stated on a card in sequence. For some spells and abilities, that means you'll scry last. For others, that means you'll scry and then perform other actions.

Scry appears on some spells and abilities with one or more targets. If all of the spell or ability's targets are illegal when it tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't scry.

cards.name: Ordeal of Purphoros
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it. Then if it has three or more +1/+1 counters on it, sacrifice Ordeal of Purphoros.
When you sacrifice Ordeal of Purphoros, it deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.original_text: Enchant creatureWhenever enchanted creature attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it. Then if it has three or more +1/+1 counters on it, sacrifice Ordeal of Purphoros.When you sacrifice Ordeal of Purphoros, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

rulings.text: The +1/+1 counter is put on the creature before blockers are declared and before combat damage is dealt.

The check of whether the enchanted creature has three or more +1/+1 counters on it happens as part of the resolution of the attack triggered ability. If the third +1/+1 counter is put on the enchanted creature any other way, you won't sacrifice the Ordeal until the next time the creature attacks.
If you sacrifice the Ordeal in some other way, its last ability will trigger.

cards.name: Bonds of Faith
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 as long as it's a Human. Otherwise, it can't attack or block.
cards.flavor:
"What cannot be destroyed will be bound."
—Oath of Avacyn
cards.original_text: Enchant creatureEnchanted creature gets +2/+2 as long as it's a Human. Otherwise, it can't attack or block.

rulings.text: Once the enchanted creature has been declared as an attacking or blocking creature, causing it to stop being a Human won't remove it from combat. It will lose the +2/+2 bonus, however.

cards.name: Moment of Heroism
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)
cards.flavor: "My faith is stronger than fang, claw, or mindless hunger."
cards.original_text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

rulings.text: Multiple instances of lifelink on the same creature are redundant.

cards.name: Undying Rage
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and can't block.
When Undying Rage is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Undying Rage to its owner's hand.
cards.original_text: Enchant creatureEnchanted creature gets +2/+2 and can't block.When Undying Rage is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Undying Rage to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: If the target of Undying Rage when it's cast as a spell is an illegal target when Undying Rage tries to resolve, Undying Rage won't resolve and will be put into its owner's graveyard. It won't return to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Battle Mastery
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has double strike. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
cards.flavor:
"Boom! Boom! Boots the size of oxcarts, then an axe like a falling sun. Elves scattered. Trees scattered. Even the hills ran for the hills!"
—Clachan Tales
cards.original_text: Enchant creatureEnchanted creature has double strike. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

rulings.text: If a creature loses double strike after dealing combat damage in the first combat damage step, it won't assign combat damage in the second one.

cards.name: Griffin Guide
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.
When enchanted creature dies, create a 2/2 white Griffin creature token with flying.
cards.original_text: Enchant creatureEnchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.When enchanted creature dies, put a 2/2 white Griffin creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

rulings.text: If Griffin Guide and the enchanted creature go to the graveyard at the same time, Griffin Guide's ability will trigger.

cards.name: Smite the Monstrous
cards.text: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater.
cards.flavor: Though the old holy wards and roadside shrines have begun to fail, faith in Avacyn still holds true power.
cards.original_text: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater.

cards.name: Miraculous Recovery
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: "I am the rock of the polis. Death only strengthens me."
cards.original_text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Winds of Rath
cards.text: Destroy all creatures that aren't enchanted. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"There shall be a vast shout and then a vaster silence."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.original_text: Destroy all creatures that aren't enchanted. They can't be regenerated.

rulings.text: A creature is "enchanted" if it has any Auras attached to it.

cards.name: Pyrokinesis
cards.text:
You may exile a red card from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Pyrokinesis deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.
cards.original_text: You may exile a red card from your hand rather than pay Pyrokinesis's mana cost.Pyrokinesis deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.

rulings.text: The number of targets must be at least one and at most four. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

You divide the damage as you cast Pyrokinesis, not as it resolves. If any of the targets become illegal, damage is dealt to the other targets as originally assigned. If all targets are illegal, Pyrokinesis doesn't resolve.
If another effect causes Pyrokinesis to cost more, you must pay that additional cost even if you pay its alternative cost.

cards.name: Boros Guildgate
cards.text:
Boros Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} or {W}.
cards.flavor: Enter with merciful hearts. Exit with battle cries.
cards.original_text: Boros Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.{T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.

rulings.text: The subtype Gate has no special rules significance, but other spells and abilities may refer to it.
Gate is not a basic land type.

cards.text:
New Benalia enters the battlefield tapped.
When New Benalia enters the battlefield, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
{T}: Add {W}.
cards.original_text: New Benalia enters the battlefield tapped.When New Benalia enters the battlefield, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.){T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Polukranos, World Eater
cards.text:
{X}{X}{G}: Monstrosity X. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put X +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)
When Polukranos, World Eater becomes monstrous, it deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures your opponents control. Each of those creatures deals damage equal to its power to Polukranos.
cards.original_text: {X}{X}{G}: Monstrosity X. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put X +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)When Polukranos, World Eater becomes monstrous, it deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures your opponents control. Each of those creatures deals damage equal to its power to Polukranos.

rulings.text: The value of X in Polukranos's last ability is equal to the value chosen for X when its activated ability was activated.

The number of targets chosen for the triggered ability must be at least one (if X wasn't 0) and at most X. You choose the division of damage as you put the ability on the stack, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage. In multiplayer games, you may choose creatures controlled by different opponents.
If some, but not all, of the ability's targets become illegal, you can't change the division of damage. Damage that would've been dealt to illegal targets simply isn't dealt.

As Polukranos's triggered ability resolves, Polukranos deals damage first, then the target creatures do. Although no creature will die until after the ability finishes resolving, the order could matter if Polukranos has wither or infect.
Once a creature becomes monstrous, it can't become monstrous again. If the creature is already monstrous when the monstrosity ability resolves, nothing happens.
Monstrous isn't an ability that a creature has. It's just something true about that creature. If the creature stops being a creature or loses its abilities, it will continue to be monstrous.
An ability that triggers when a creature becomes monstrous won't trigger if that creature isn't on the battlefield when its monstrosity ability resolves.

foreign_names.name: 世界を喰らう者、ポルクラノス

cards.name: Orcish Lumberjack
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Add three mana in any combination of {R} and/or {G}.
cards.flavor:
"Wood is wasted in the dirt."
—Orcish proverb
cards.original_text: {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Add three mana in any combination of {R} and/or {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Deadly Recluse
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
cards.flavor: Even dragons fear its silken strands.
cards.original_text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.name: Kavu Predator
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever an opponent gains life, put that many +1/+1 counters on Kavu Predator.
cards.flavor: In a withered world, the scent of healthy prey is enough to drive a predator to frenzy.
cards.original_text: TrampleWhenever an opponent gains life, put that many +1/+1 counters on Kavu Predator.

rulings.text: Kavu Predator's last ability triggers just once for each life-gaining event, whether it's 1 life from Kor Firewalker or 6 life from Renewed Faith.

Each creature with lifelink dealing combat damage is a single life-gaining event. For example, if two creatures an opponent controls with lifelink deal combat damage at the same time, Kavu Predator's ability will trigger twice. However, if a single creature an opponent controls with lifelink deals combat damage to multiple creatures, players, and/or planeswalkers at the same time (perhaps because it has trample or was blocked by more than one creature), the ability will trigger only once.
If an opponent gains an amount of life "for each" of something (such as from Congregate), that life is gained as one event and Kavu Predator's ability triggers only once.

cards.name: Satyr Hedonist
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice Satyr Hedonist: Add {R}{R}{R}.
cards.flavor: "Any festival you can walk away from wasn't worth attending in the first place."
cards.original_text: {R}, Sacrifice Satyr Hedonist: Add {R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.

rulings.text: Satyr Hedonist's ability is a mana ability. It doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to.

cards.name: Zhur-Taa Druid
cards.text:
{T}: Add {G}.
Whenever you tap Zhur-Taa Druid for mana, it deals 1 damage to each opponent.
cards.flavor: "Only the decadent think magic should be pristine and without cost."
cards.original_text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.Whenever you tap Zhur-Taa Druid for mana, it deals 1 damage to each opponent.

rulings.text: Zhur-Taa Druid's last ability doesn't trigger if it becomes tapped for any other reason. However, if Zhur-Taa Druid gains another mana ability that requires you tap it, its ability will trigger.
If you tap Zhur-Taa Druid for mana during the process of casting a spell or activating an ability, its triggered ability will resolve before that spell or ability.
Zhur-Taa Druid's last ability isn't a mana ability. It uses the stack and can be responded to.

cards.text:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.original_text: Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)First strike

cards.name: Troll Ascetic
cards.text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate Troll Ascetic.
cards.flavor: It's no coincidence that the oldest trolls are also the angriest.
cards.original_text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.){1}{G}: Regenerate Troll Ascetic.

cards.name: Crowned Ceratok
cards.text:
Trample
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it has trample.
cards.flavor: The best way to calm a rampaging ceratok is to wait until it dies of natural causes.
cards.original_text: TrampleEach creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it has trample.

cards.name: Gorehorn Minotaurs
cards.text: Bloodthirst 2 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.)
cards.flavor: Some of the eleven minotaur clans of Mirtiin are expert crafters and learned philosophers. Others just like to hit stuff.
cards.original_text: Bloodthirst 2 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.)

foreign_names.name: 血まみれ角のミノタウルス

cards.name: Ghor-Clan Savage
cards.text: Bloodthirst 3 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.)
cards.flavor: The snap of sinew. The crunch of bone. A cry for mercy. These are the music of the Gruul.
cards.original_text: Bloodthirst 3 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.)

cards.name: Deus of Calamity
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Deus of Calamity deals 6 or more damage to an opponent, destroy target land that player controls.
cards.flavor:
"He bears the marks of ages upon his skin, memories of dreams long dead and best left buried."
—The Seer's Parables
cards.original_text: TrampleWhenever Deus of Calamity deals 6 or more damage to an opponent, destroy target land that player controls.

rulings.text: This ability will trigger when Deus of Calamity deals 6 damage to an opponent at one time. It won't keep track of the accumulated damage that it deals at different times.
This ability triggers from any damage, not just combat damage, that Deus of Calamity deals to an opponent in increments of 6 or more.

cards.name: Conquering Manticore
cards.text:
Flying
When Conquering Manticore enters the battlefield, gain control of target creature an opponent controls until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It speaks no commands but is always obeyed.
cards.original_text: FlyingWhen Conquering Manticore enters the battlefield, gain control of target creature an opponent controls until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.

rulings.text: You may target a creature that's already untapped.
You retain control of the affected creature until end of turn, even if you lose control of Conquering Manticore before then.

foreign_names.name: 征服するマンティコア

cards.name: Crater Hellion
cards.text:
Echo {4}{R}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Crater Hellion enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to each other creature.
cards.original_text: Echo {4}{R}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)When Crater Hellion enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to each other creature.

cards.name: Skarrgan Firebird
cards.text:
Bloodthirst 3 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.)
Flying
{R}{R}{R}: Return Skarrgan Firebird from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only if an opponent was dealt damage this turn.
cards.original_text: Bloodthirst 3 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.)Flying{R}{R}{R}: Return Skarrgan Firebird from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only if an opponent was dealt damage this turn.

rulings.text: You can activate Skarrgan Firebird's last ability if an opponent was dealt damage by any source, even if you didn't control that source.

cards.name: Valley Rannet
cards.text: Mountaincycling {2}, forestcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Mountain or Forest card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)
cards.original_text: Mountaincycling {2}, forestcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Mountain or Forest card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, landcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a land card of the specified land type, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Landcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on a card being landcycled. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops a landcycling ability from being activated.

You can choose to find any card with the appropriate land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a land card with the appropriate type in your library.
A landcycling ability lets you search for any card in your library with the stated land type. It doesn't have to be a basic land.
You may only activate one landcycling ability at a time. You must specify which landcycling ability you are activating as you cycle this card, not as the ability resolves.

cards.name: Krosan Tusker
cards.text:
Cycling {2}{G} ({2}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Krosan Tusker, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library. (Do this before you draw.)
cards.original_text: Cycling {2}{G} ({2}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)When you cycle Krosan Tusker, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn't resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.

cards.name: Skarrgan Skybreaker
cards.text:
Bloodthirst 3 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.)
{1}, Sacrifice Skarrgan Skybreaker: It deals damage equal to its power to any target.
cards.flavor:
"The sky isn't falling—it's being thrown at us!"
—Otak, Tin Street shopkeep
cards.original_text: Bloodthirst 3 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.){1}, Sacrifice Skarrgan Skybreaker: Skarrgan Skybreaker deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.

cards.name: Shower of Sparks
cards.text: Shower of Sparks deals 1 damage to target creature and 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: The viashino had learned how to operate the rig through trial and error—mostly error.
cards.original_text: Shower of Sparks deals 1 damage to target creature and 1 damage to target player.

rulings.text: If the creature leaves the battlefield before this resolves, it still damages the player.

cards.name: Prey Upon
cards.text: Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
cards.flavor:
"You don't find many old werewolf hunters."
—Paulin, trapper of Somberwald
cards.original_text: Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

rulings.text: If either or both targets are illegal when Prey Upon tries to resolve, no creature will deal or be dealt damage.

cards.name: Pyroclasm
cards.text: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.
cards.flavor:
"Who'd want to ignite things one at a time?"
—Chandra Nalaar
cards.original_text: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.

cards.name: Regrowth
cards.text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: While the root remains, the tree yet lives.
cards.original_text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Terrifying Presence
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by creatures other than target creature this turn.
cards.flavor: Elmut had slaughtered vampires, slain werewolves, and destroyed hordes of zombies. Sadly, he never got over his fear of spiders.
cards.original_text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by creatures other than target creature this turn.

rulings.text: Although Terrifying Presence doesn't affect the target creature, if that creature is an illegal target when Terrifying Presence tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. No damage will be prevented.

cards.name: Destructive Revelry
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. Destructive Revelry deals 2 damage to that permanent's controller.
cards.flavor:
"Stoke a fire hot enough and you'll never run out of things to burn."
—Xenagos, the Reveler
cards.original_text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. Destructive Revelry deals 2 damage to that permanent's controller.

rulings.text: You must target an artifact or enchantment to cast Destructive Revelry. If that artifact or enchantment is an illegal target when Destructive Revelry tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. No damage will be dealt. However, if Destructive Revelry resolves and the artifact or enchantment isn't destroyed (perhaps because it has indestructible), damage will be dealt.

cards.name: Dragon Blood
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.flavor: A single drop turns skin to scale and fist to claw.
cards.original_text: {3}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Volt Charge
cards.text: Volt Charge deals 3 damage to any target. Proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)
cards.original_text: Volt Charge deals 3 damage to target creature or player. Proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)

rulings.text: If the permanent or player is an illegal target when Volt Charge tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't proliferate.

cards.name: Beast Within
cards.text: Destroy target permanent. Its controller creates a 3/3 green Beast creature token.
cards.flavor:
"Monsters dwell in every heart. We only think civilization tames them."
—Euphemia, Nexus watcher
cards.original_text: Destroy target permanent. Its controller puts a 3/3 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield.

rulings.text: If the permanent is an illegal target when Beast Within tries to resolve, the spell won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. The permanent's controller won't get a Beast token.
If the permanent is still a legal target but is not destroyed (perhaps because it regenerated or has indestructible), its controller still gets the Beast token.
